    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Tackling the usage of DRM and textbooks]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/tackling-the-usage-of-drm-and-textbooks/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Tony McSherry looks at DRM and the electronic publishing of textbooks.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/tackling-the-usage-of-drm-and-textbooks/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 22 Jan 2014 01:13:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Twitter quietly switches off HTTP connections to API]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/twitter-quietly-switches-off-http-connections-to-api/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[If your Twitter API requests were having issues over the past couple of days, changing to an SSL connection should fix your problems.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/twitter-quietly-switches-off-http-connections-to-api/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Fri, 17 Jan 2014 05:35:38 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[4G to the rescue from slow broadband upload speeds]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/4g-to-the-rescue-from-slow-broadband-upload-speeds/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Wireless-N routers and adapters can give your network a speed boost, but the more connections you have in-house, the slower you go. If you need better upload speeds, consider your 4G phone.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/4g-to-the-rescue-from-slow-broadband-upload-speeds/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 15 Jan 2014 22:04:33 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Catch up on Linux.conf.au 2014]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/catch-up-on-linuxconfau-2014/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[If you failed to make the trip to Perth for LCA this year, you are able to watch most of the talks online.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/catch-up-on-linuxconfau-2014/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 00:55:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[An exercise in fragmentation: Limiting Android installs to device models]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/an-exercise-in-fragmentation-limiting-android-installs-to-device-models/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[As if there were not enough fragmentation issues with Android, app makers go out and make it worse when they limit installations to specific devices.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/an-exercise-in-fragmentation-limiting-android-installs-to-device-models/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 18 Dec 2013 22:21:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Australian enterprises turn focus from BYOD to apps]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/australian-enterprises-turn-focus-from-byod-to-apps/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Having come to grips with consumerisation and BYOD entering the marketplace, Australian businesses have set their target on creating apps to serve internal and external customers.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/australian-enterprises-turn-focus-from-byod-to-apps/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 Dec 2013 00:13:23 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Good accessibility is good web page design]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/good-accessibility-is-good-web-page-design/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Accessibility isn't something that should be added onto a web page, it should be baked in.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/good-accessibility-is-good-web-page-design/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 04 Dec 2013 00:55:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Take your app on the road, put it in a car]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/take-your-app-on-the-road-put-it-in-a-car/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Looking for a new market or adding a unique edge to your app? Then support for in-car usage could be just the ticket.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/take-your-app-on-the-road-put-it-in-a-car/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 27 Nov 2013 03:38:21 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Navigating the morass of systemd, NetworkManager, and GNOME 3.10]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/navigating-the-morass-of-systemd-networkmanager-and-gnome-310/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[The world of Linux: Where making a laptop engage its wired connection when attached to a dock is an exercise in frustration.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/navigating-the-morass-of-systemd-networkmanager-and-gnome-310/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 21 Nov 2013 00:02:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Google opens App Translation Service to all Android devs]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/google-opens-app-translation-service-to-all-android-devs/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Android developers are now able to purchase app translation services from the Android developer console.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/google-opens-app-translation-service-to-all-android-devs/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Tue, 12 Nov 2013 05:54:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Microsoft unifies Windows and Windows Phone store dev accounts]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/microsoft-unifies-windows-and-windows-phone-store-dev-accounts/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Redmond continues down the long path of moving its phone and desktop environments closer.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/microsoft-unifies-windows-and-windows-phone-store-dev-accounts/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 07 Nov 2013 00:36:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Cisco to release open-source H.264 codec, Mozilla makes tactical retreat]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/cisco-to-release-open-source-h264-codec-mozilla-makes-tactical-retreat/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Mozilla has yet to completely win or lose the war on video codecs, but has made a tactical retreat to preserve its forces, according to Ogg Vorbis creator Monty Montgomery.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/cisco-to-release-open-source-h264-codec-mozilla-makes-tactical-retreat/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 31 Oct 2013 05:16:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Amazon brings Glacier and Redshift to Australia]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/amazon-brings-glacier-and-redshift-to-australia/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Data archiving and warehousing services arrive in antipodes, but, once again, at an increased cost.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Duckett]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/amazon-brings-glacier-and-redshift-to-australia/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 09 Oct 2013 02:32:45 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Stallman celebrates 30 years of Free Software by decrying SaaS]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/stallman-celebrates-30-years-of-free-software-by-decrying-saas/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[To the GNU project founder, it doesn't matter whether the cloud is using a free software stack, as it is still evil.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/stallman-celebrates-30-years-of-free-software-by-decrying-saas/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 30 Sep 2013 06:49:58 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Using IP cameras to create a security system]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/using-ip-cameras-to-create-a-security-system/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Not all security is in software, and Tony McSherry shows how to make a home camera system on the cheap.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/australian-technology/using-ip-cameras-to-create-a-security-system/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Tue, 24 Sep 2013 05:40:26 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
  </channel>
